item.title: Model error when compiling (PI)
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

You put the code in the incorrect spot. Add it into the switch statement within the forID method of ItemDef.java, if there isn’t a switch statement, you could make one by adding it under this code:


		if(!isMembers && itemDef.membersObject) {
			itemDef.name = "Members Object";
			itemDef.description = "Login to a members' server to use this object.".getBytes();
			itemDef.groundActions = null;
			itemDef.actions = null;
			itemDef.team = 0;
		}

Or equivalent in your client.

Read full topic

item.title: Model error when compiling (PI)
item.dc:creator: @ice_m4n1 ice m4n1
item.description:
@ice_m4n1 wrote:

I added spirit shield models to cache, i do not have a raw folder but i have a data folder within cache with .dat files but they seem to be dead. i cant open them in a .dat maker.

I added ints in item.def (not sure if done correctly or put in right place)

case 11526:
itemDef.name = “Elysian spirit shield”;
itemDef.modelid = 40915;
itemDef.modelZoom = 1616;
itemDef.modelRotationY = 1050;
itemDef.modelRotationX = 396;
itemDef.modelOffset1 = -3;
itemDef.modelOffset2 =9;
itemDef.anInt165 = 40942;
itemDef.anInt200 = 40942;
itemDef.itemActions = new String[5];
itemDef.itemActions[1] = “Wear”;
itemDef.description = “An ethereal shield”;
break;

ThIS is my error

ItemDef.java:175: error: illegal start of type
case 11526:
^
ItemDef.java:175: error: ‘;’ expected
case 11526:
^
ItemDef.java:175: error: illegal start of type
case 11526:
^

itemDef.name = “Elysian spirit shield”;
^

itemDef.name = “Elysian spirit shield”;

itemDef.modelid = 40915;

^

^
ItemDef.java:183: error: expected
itemDef.anInt165 = 40942;
^

itemDef.anInt200 = 40942;
^
ItemDef.java:185: error: expected
itemDef.itemActions = new String[5];
^
ItemDef.java:186: error: ‘]’ expected
itemDef.itemActions[1] = “Wear”;
^
ItemDef.java:186: error: ‘;’ expected
itemDef.itemActions[1] = “Wear”;
^

itemDef.itemActions[1] = “Wear”;
^
ItemDef.java:186: error: expected

^

Help please
